title: Prepare a 2.1 release
body:
@diesel-rs/core I propose to release a 2.1 version of diesel "soon" (hopefully on Friday?). 
If possible I would like to include the following outstanding PR's:

* #3636 
* #3628 
* #3552 

(All assuming that they are finished and accepted till the release)

The PR to update the webpage is here: https://github.com/sgrif/diesel.rs-website/pull/199

@diesel-rs/core Do you have any concerns or do you want any other feature to be included?

title: Emit an error and abort if the provided `.env` is invalid
body: We previously silently ignored such invalid files which seems to be confusing form some users and results in hard to debug issues with their `.env` setups as they seem to expect support for all sort of stuff in the `.env` (See #3633 for such a case)

title: Fix compile fails on target `aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu` with feature mysql
Allow for "bool" type from django with tests
body:
Taken from PR #3239:
> Hey all.
> 
> Encountered this issue while attempting to modernize a Django app by running `diesel print-schema` on an already created SQLite3 db, which returned `Unsupported type: bool`.
> 
> Django appears to have [used `"bool"` for their types](https://github.com/django/django/blob/24effbceb871e71d3bc320b91252f743714722df/django/db/backends/sqlite3/base.py#L32) instead of `"boolean"`.

This PR is continued from #3239, with two additions

- `type_name.contains("bool")` has been changed to `type_name.starts_with("bool")` to match fewer cases. 
- test has been implemented in diesel_cli/tests/print_schema.rs

title: Update advanced blog example
body: `structopt` is kinda deprecated

title: Multi column `distinct_on` for Postgresql
body:
- Add ability to define multiple columns in a single `distinct_on` for PostgreSQL, like: `.distinct_on((column_a, column_b))`. Main files related to this:
  - https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3628/files#diff-556fca1d890492102d32274fc8da5ebdf8759195ac66e9df5aec8ae849ea2c54
  - https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3628/files#diff-0e5dba8a60dbbbead443c0ba8d1120357269b3f38ff74225b4a9d4a856145800
  - https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3628/files#diff-556fca1d890492102d32274fc8da5ebdf8759195ac66e9df5aec8ae849ea2c54
- Fixed some tiny typos and grammar issues

title: Add ability to specify `ssl_cert` and `ssl_key` for MySql
body: Also updated docs for `MysqlConnection` per https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions/3624#discussioncomment-5869196

title: Update benchmarks
body:
* Update outdated dependencies where possible (sea-orm 0.11, some minor updates)
* Improve the `metrics.yaml` file so that it's now easier to copy these commands
* Add missing where clauses to some cases of the medium_complex_query benchmarks

title: Fix #3506
body:
This commit fixes #3506 by not running the diesel migration redo command in a transaction if any affected transaction specifies `run_in_transaction = false`.

It also adds some tests for this case.

title: Remove cargo's audit allowlist that is no longer needed
body: The allowlist item has been introduced by #2928 & #2955. The item is no longer needed after chrono has been fixed on 0.4.20 in #3264.

title: Add support for `#[diesel(check_for_backend())]` to `#[derive(Queryab…
body:
…leByName)]`

Similar to the support in `#[diesel(Selectable)]` this makes it much easier to debug potential field type mismatches by greatly improving the generated error messages.

title: Fix #3566
body: This commit fixes various issues with backend dependent `QueryFragment` impls in combination with `#[derive(Multiconnection)]`. In all cases we solve these issues by not calling the concrete backend specific `QueryFragment` impl early in the query building process. Instead we call the generic `MultiBackend` specific impl, that later defer to the correct implementation specific one. In addition this commit adds some test for the fixed cases.

title: Fix #3601
body: This PR fixes #3601 by adding the missing impls + adding a regression test

title: Add examples using explicit joins for {Inner,Left}JoinQuerySource
Add examples using composite types with `Selectable`
Use appropriate postgres datatype as foreign key
body:
PostgreSQL foreign key should be a true datatype.

SERIAL would cause postgres to create a sequence and use setval() as default.

https://www.postgresql.org/docs/15/datatype-numeric.html#DATATYPE-SERIAL

title: docs(pg): unhide docs from some type aliases
body: Removed `#[doc(hidden)]` from 2 PostgreSQL type aliases, as discussed on matrix

title: Change incorrect uses of mysql feature to mysql_backend
body:
As noted [here](https://github.com/weiznich/diesel_async/issues/70), some MySQL types are unavailable when compiling with `mysql_backend` when they should be, instead using `mysql`.

`InsertOrIgnore` is the only one I've personally run in to, but I did a full repo search and there were 3 other files that looked like they might also require changing too, but I am not certain – so please do check those closely.

title: Bump libsqlite3-sys to allow 0.26 as well
Update all the crates to the 2021 edition
body: This is mostly just running `cargo fix --edition` and `cargo fix --edition-idioms`

title: Fix type resolution in rust-analyzer
body:
It turns out that we relay on a type resolution hack for our derives that only work with rust 2015. That's not a problem with rustc, as it uses whatever edition a crate is using. So it will use rust-2015 for name resolution in the expansion of our proc macros, due to the fact that `diesel_derives` is a edition = 2015 crate. The problem is that rust-analyzer does not understand this, as they use basically the name resolution rules from the 2018 edition. (To be clear that's something that's not "standard" conform there, but it does not seem to be a priority to fix that).
As this affects our core type system (== all the SQL types, …), that has pretty serve effects on what users see in their IDE.

Fortunately the workaround is simple as we just need to use an alternative way to provide an diesel item in diesel itself to make our macros work there. It seems like both rustc and rust-analyzer agree on the `extern crate self as diesel;` solution.

After this basically all known cases of rust-analyzer issues are gone away (at least as far as I tested).

Before: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1674512/227608517-7d1766db-f67a-422e-ba66-5722a7fef15b.png)


After: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1674512/227608301-7b137352-bcd5-452c-8a5a-2fda68df00c3.png)

title: Syn/2.0
body: This updates our dependency on `syn` to the latest 2.0 release. Also it removes the `proc_macro_error` crate as that requires syn 1.x

title: impl<'a, Parent, Child> BelongingToDsl<(&'a [Parent], &'a [Parent])> for Child
body: See [discussions#3559](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions/3559)

title: Fix #3558
body: This commit fixes an issue where out of bound text/binary binds on `sql_query` using the sqlite backend causes a panic in an internal drop impl. It was caused that we pushed to the list of released binds before we actually checked whether that bind was possible or not. This caused us trying to bind to the same invalid bind again in the drop impl, while being on the normal error path. It's fixed by just moving the relevant push after the actual bind. In addition a regression test for this problem is added.

title: Add some documentation about common compiler error message types that users can encounter if something goes wrong
body: There are a few quite common error cases that generate large complicated looking messages, but that are quite easy to break down if the error message does not scare you away. This documentation section tries to give users a potential starting point where they need to look for the issue that causes the error message.

title: Deny unsafe code
body: This commit denies unsafe code. It allows the usage of unsafe code only in specific locations and add some comments why it's allowed there. I hope that this helps in the future to detect new unsafe code locations and discuss there need.

title: Implement field length introspection and make available in schema
body: Resolves #3551

title: Update the getting started examples to use `Selectable` + `check_for_backend`
body: That should prevent users from running into nasty compile errors if they try to modify these examples slightly. Will update the guide on the webpage in a separate PR.

title: Allow binding unsized types in AstPass::push_bind_param
body: This has the cost of some allocation overhead for `DebugQuery`, but it is convenient to be able to use `push_bind_param` with `str` and slices. In my particular use case this makes migrating to Diesel 2.0 easier.

title: Fix print_schema
body:
That was broken as of e90dfe0cf5549fa35eff81f3f4e01449911d3df4

https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/0f15f89b6b025c9a49bbf6d612a57aaa1a78452a/diesel_cli/src/print_schema.rs#L642-L652 https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/0f15f89b6b025c9a49bbf6d612a57aaa1a78452a/diesel_cli/src/print_schema.rs#L548

1. It triggers not if we are generating for mysql, but if we have the mysql feature enabled. So if you have a CLI that happens to *support* mysql because it's compiled with that feature, then it attempts to perform some replacements.
2. This looks up by column name and not by column name + table name, so it picks any column with the same name even if it's for a different table.
3. It's not ok to dedup pg types by name (https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/0f15f89b6b025c9a49bbf6d612a57aaa1a78452a/diesel_cli/src/print_schema.rs#L227) if lookup for `use` statement generation is made by column - even if that were to be "fixed" to include the table (https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/0f15f89b6b025c9a49bbf6d612a57aaa1a78452a/diesel_cli/src/print_schema.rs#L548)

-----

What this does:
- Represents the requirement of import and override for columns by a 2d array of `ColumnType` that zips with the definitions arrays of tables and columns, so that remapping is obvious and we don't have to search for it in a custom types array and filter on backend-specific conditions
- Backend-specific dedup/no-dedup of rust types with regards to the `sql_types` module is done in the code that generates the `sql_types` module

title: Fix #3541
body:
This is #3543 but on master

This commit fixes a breaking change of an non-public quote API by replacing the usage of this API with a stable API in syn

title: Fix #3541
body:
This commit fixes a breaking change of an non-public quote API by replacing the usage of this API with a stable API in syn

cc @diesel-rs/core I plan to release that as soon as the CI passes.

title: make Desc<DistinctOn>/Asc<DistinctOn> valid ordering for distinct
body: Closes #3020

title: derive(Insertable) into multiple tables
body: Closes #1314

title: Fix filter docs
body:
One of the code example missed a `/`, resulting in it being shown incorrectly.
See currently broken page here: [trait.QueryDsl.html#method.filter](https://docs.diesel.rs/master/diesel/query_dsl/trait.QueryDsl.html#method.filter).

title: Extend the readme
body:
This commit extends the readme as the old one is somehow too short for lib.rs to probably rank diesel as important crate. https://gitlab.com/crates.rs/crates.rs/-/issues/138

This commit just includes the code examples from the diesel.rs landing page.

[Rendered](https://github.com/weiznich/diesel/tree/better_readme#readme)

title: Allow `#[derive(Multiconnection)]` to be used without opting into
body:
unstable diesel features

As we control the derive code it should be possible to just adjust the code as soon as some internal detail changes

title: Better wording for a `on_unimplemented` error message
Fix #2793
body: We accepted invalid identifier in some positions and emitted bad error messages while trying to expand code containing these identifiers. This commit adds some additional verification to check for those invalid identifiers and emits a better error message when they are found.

title: Mysql enum and mysql set support to print-schema
body:
This is the same as the reverted https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3522 but the PG issue from https://github.com/Ten0/tmp_issue_repro_diesel_3522 should be fixed.

I'm having trouble with the unit tests. I've created a unit test, to reproduce the issue @Ten0 is having, but on every run of the tests I have a derive pop in and out of existence for some reason:

run 1: #[derive(diesel::query_builder::QueryId, diesel::sql_types::SqlType)]
run 2: #[derive(diesel::sql_types::SqlType)]
run 3: #[derive(diesel::query_builder::QueryId, diesel::sql_types::SqlType)]

otherwise the code generates ok.

title: Revert "Add mysql enum and mysql set support to print-schema"
body:
Reverts diesel-rs/diesel#3522
It is broken - at least on PG.
It generates duplicate use statements for enums, and some non-nullable fields holding these enums are generated as nullable.

Reopens #3386

(@weiznich not sure whether you think I should insta merge-when-ready in this kind of scenario?)

title: Add mysql enum and mysql set support to print-schema
body:
Related issue https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues/3386

Clippy and rusfmt are happy. Tested this with:
```shell
cargo check --no-default-features --features mysql
cargo check --no-default-features --features postgres
cargo check --no-default-features --features sqlite
cargo check
```

Generated code in `sql_types`:
![DeepinScreenshot_select-area_20230221155014](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7164437/220368733-ba9d44c5-1b64-422c-abb1-550cdc81741d.png)

Generated code in table definition:
![DeepinScreenshot_select-area_20230221154948](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7164437/220368698-be8b92bd-f8a9-4d83-8f63-b5e400c32f97.png)

I'm not sure if there should be an `Enum` suffix on the generated types.

Tested this with a 57 table database, compiling the generated schema yields no errors or warnings, but I haven't tested using it. Also haven't tested generating a schema for sqlite or postgres.

title: Add a example project for the upcoming relations guide
body: See here for the corresponding PR to the webpage: https://github.com/sgrif/diesel.rs-website/pull/183

title: Bump libsqlite3-sys from 0.23.1 to 0.25.1 in /diesel_compile_tests

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [libsqlite3-sys](https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite) from 0.23.1 to 0.25.1.
Release notes

Sourced from libsqlite3-sys's releases.

libsqlite3-sys 0.25.1

Bumped bundled version of SQLite to 3.39.2. See official release notes for further information: https://www.sqlite.org/releaselog/3_39_2.html.

0.25.0

  • BREAKING CHANGE: Overhaul parameter API #830 / #609
  • Add ToSql implementations for u64 and usize #826 / #821
  • Implement FromSql for u64, usize and f32, and ToSql for f32 #823 / #822 / #821
  • Reduce required lifetime in create_scalar_function #825
  • Expose query progress information and introduce Batch iterator #824 / #803
  • Add #[inline] and #[cold] in far more places #834
  • Fix create_collation #839
  • Remove #[non_exhaustive] attribute on IndexConstraintOp #840 / #783
  • Document that optional() requires import of trait rusqlite::OptionalExtension #842
  • Update time to appease deps.rs #849
  • Upgrade to bindgen 0.57
  • Improve busy handler documentation #854
  • Upgrade SQLite bundled version to 3.35.4
  • Expands/cleans up documentation. Also renames (and documents) the so-far-undocumented LIBSQLITE3_FLAGS. #861
  • Add get_connection method to function context #867
  • Fix smallvec version #896
  • BREAKING CHANGE: Pass context to aggregate init and finalize #866
  • BREAKING CHANGE: Rename get_raw to get_ref_unwrap and get_raw_checked to get_ref #838
  • BREAKING CHANGE: Fix DateTime format #886 / #885 + Leniently parse rfc3339 timezones #928

rusqlite 0.24.2

v0.24.2 is identical to v0.24.1 except it allows building with an older version of smallvec, as the newer one caused meaningful performance issues in Firefox.

See rusqlite/rusqlite#855 for more info.

libsqlite3-sys 0.24.1

This release contains an update to the bundled version of SQLcipher, and no other changes. The update moves it to SQLcipher v4.5.1, which is equivalent to SQLite 3.37.2. (The version of SQLcipher bundled previously was v4.5.0, equivalent to SQLite 3.36.0)

Note that this is still a version behind the copy of "plain" SQLite we pull in under features = ["bundled"], which is SQLite 3.38.0.

There is no corresponding rusqlite release, as this will trickle out out over time, and Rusqlite itself does not care about the version change. That said, if you use rusqlite, and absolutely must ensure you have this change, it should be sufficient to run cargo update in the rusqlite-using workspace, which will update the version in your Cargo.lock file. You may instead add a direct dependency on libsqlite3-sys = "0.24.1" to your Cargo.toml, in case relying on Cargo.lock for this is undesirable.

Commits
  • 9ea5e2f Prepare release of rusqlite 0.25.1 (#940)
  • 3519aef Use SQLITE_TEMP_STORE=3 on android. (#937)
  • ddf69f7 Upgrade to bindgen 0.58 (#933)
  • 6c956bb Test that extra_check feature works with RETURNING statements (#932)
  • 517ef2b Prepare release 0.25.0 (#930)
  • f6a69be Upgrade SQLite bundled version to 3.35.4 (#929)
  • 8820a55 Fix smallvec version (#896)
  • c4b398f Doctest column name reference (#918)
  • ecbc0aa Leniently parse rfc3339 timezones (#928)
  • ed3bfbd Silent some clippy warnings (#924)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=libsqlite3-sys&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.23.1&new-version=0.25.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Fix a broken doc link
body: Works around https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/107995

title: Fix copy/paste issue in group_by documentation.
body: It looks like the `group_by()` documentation was probably copied from `order()`, but this particular phrase was missed when tweaking it to apply to 'group_by' instead of `order()`.

title: Fix supported databases docs links
body:
The readme links are broken

Supported databases:
1. [PostgreSQL](https://docs.diesel.rs/diesel/pg/index.html)
2. [MySQL](https://docs.diesel.rs/diesel/mysql/index.html)
3. [SQLite](https://docs.diesel.rs/diesel/sqlite/index.html)

#3508

title: Fix `FileBasedMigrations` documentation
body:
The `run_in_transaction` example for `FileBasedMigrations` has most of its documentation hidden by rustdoc because a single `#` is used to [hide portions of the example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rustdoc/write-documentation/documentation-tests.html#hiding-portions-of-the-example), while the intent seems to have been toml comments

This PR escapes them by using `##` instead so it renders correctly

title: Expose TransactionBuilder::new behind feature flag
body: Addresses #3500

title: Introduce a `--diff-schema` flag for `diesel migration generate`
body:
If that flag is set diesel-cli will compare the current `schema.rs` file against the provided database and generate a corresponding stub for up/down migrations. This feature is not designed to generate perfect migrations all the times, but to generate the "boring" stuff most of the time.

It currently handles:
* Adding/Droping tables
* Adding/Dropping columns

It mostly generates the correct sql side types in most of the cases, although that depends a bit on what users specify (see the test cases for examples). It is expected that users need to check and potentially modify the generated migrations. I would expect that the type mapping get some improvements over time as people start using this feature

It cannot handle more complex patterns like changing primary keys or adding unique indices or migrating the data stored in tables itself. This is by definition not part of the designed feature set and will always require manual input from the user.

title: Rust 1.67 is released
body: This PR updates the used local toolchain to 1.67 and fixes all new clippy warnings

title: Bump bumpalo from 3.10.0 to 3.12.0 in /diesel_compile_tests

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [bumpalo](https://github.com/fitzgen/bumpalo) from 3.10.0 to 3.12.0.
Changelog

Sourced from bumpalo's changelog.

3.12.0

Released 2023-01-17.

Added

  • Added the bumpalo::boxed::Box::bump and bumpalo::collections::String::bump getters to get the underlying Bump that a string or box was allocated into.

Changed

  • Some uses of Box that MIRI did not previously consider as UB are now reported as UB, and bumpalo's internals have been adjusted to avoid the new UB.

3.11.1

Released 2022-10-18.

Security

  • Fixed a bug where when std::vec::IntoIter was ported to bumpalo::collections::vec::IntoIter, it didn't get its underlying Bump's lifetime threaded through. This meant that rustc was not checking the borrows for bumpalo::collections::IntoIter and this could result in use-after-free bugs.

3.11.0

Released 2022-08-17.

Added

  • Added support for per-Bump allocation limits. These are enforced only in the slow path when allocating new chunks in the Bump, not in the bump allocation hot path, and therefore impose near zero overhead.
  • Added the bumpalo::boxed::Box::into_inner method.

Changed

  • Updated to Rust 2021 edition.
  • The minimum supported Rust version (MSRV) is now 1.56.0.
Commits
  • 50ba1bd Bump to 3.12.0
  • 3dd3650 Merge pull request #190 from mattfbacon/main
  • 37be9a9 Merge branch 'fitzgen:main' into main
  • 3664dbb Add String::bump method
  • 701514f Merge pull request #189 from mattfbacon/main
  • c6507f7 Add Vec::bump method
  • b1e67b7 Merge pull request #188 from saethlin/field-retagging
  • d325e2c Use ManuallyDrop with bumpalo's Box instead of mem::forget
  • c699cd1 Merge pull request #183 from stepancheg/allocated-bytes-no-headers
  • 5805a29 Clarify allocated_bytes does not include headers
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Update benchmarks
body: This unbreaks the benchmark builds

title: Backport fixes
body: This PR backports the fixes for #3412 (from #3413) and #3470 (from #3474). In addition this PR reintroduces two functions removed by #3474 for backward compatibility reasons. (We promised to only remove/change functions marked as "i-implement-a-third-party-backend-and-opt-into-breaking-changes" in minor releases, not in patch releases)

title: Update the error messages generated by clap to 4.1
mention possibility to bundle SQLite
body: See https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions/3255

title: DOCS: add precision for interaction with .select
body:
Closes #3321 
Please feel free to reach out with any suggestions or questions regarding this PR.

title: Fix #3470
body:
This commit tries to address an issue where we do not issue rollback to savepoint commands due to libpq reporting a transaction as broken. It turns out that transactions are sometimes recoverable by just rolling back to a previous savepoint instead of rolling back the outer transaction.

We address this issue by always executing the `ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT` command even if a connection is required as needing a top level rollback. This was previously skipped. We do ignore any errors from that attempt if the requires top level rollback flag is set. If the `ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT` command succeeds, we consider the transaction as recovered and disable the requires top level rollback flag.

cc @jtgeibel

title: Use postgres_backend instead of bare postgres feature for now expression
Use `#[derive(MultiConnection)]`  in the implementation of diesel-cli
Allow displaying only SQL comments in CLI generated doc
body:
We find generated doc when `with-docs` is enabled too large to browse the `schema.rs` comfortably, so we currently have it disabled.
However we'd like to also see the SQL comments.
#3281 introduced reading these, but we can't have these comments without the large generated ones as well.

This PR introduces option to configure the following 3 modes:
- `database-comments-fallback-to-auto-generated-doc-comment`
- `only-database-comments`
- `no-doc-comments`

It is implemented in a backwards-compatible manner.

To preserve the previous behavior of the CLI where `with-docs` was a flag, it's mapped to `with-docs-config`.

In the `diesel.toml` however, the `with-docs` field can be both a boolean (previous behavior) or one of the above strings.

title: Fix #3446
body: This commit fixes an issue where diesel print-schema incorrectly emitted a `joinable!` call for compound foreign keys by filtering out such foreign key constraints more explicitly.

title: Add Conditionally InsertStatement
body: Allow to apply filters on `ON CONFLICT ... DO UPDATE ... WHERE ...`

title: typo fix for `nullable()` documentation
body: I guess..

title: Fix #3425
body:
This commit fixes an issue where empty owned strings (and `Vec<u8>`) were serialised to null values instead of to just empty values. This happened due to a passing null ptrs to the sqlite API at the wrong location.

Also two regression tests are added for this issue.

title: register is_nullable as a reserved name due to the clash with a modul…
body:
…e with the same name

Fixes #3404

title: Fix #3412
body: This commits fixes an issue that disallowed the usage of `BoxableExpression` as order clause due to a malformed trait impl in diesel.

title: Replace usage of deprecated chrono functions
Add more information about specifying a mysql connection
Add a `#[derive(MultiConnection)]` proc-macro
Implement Default on tables
body:
**Good to know:**
- Useful when building generic code around tables (same as columns)

title: Update dependencies for benchmarks
body: This updates sea-orm to 0.10 and quaint to their latest git version

title: Try to debug metrics issue
body: This PR fixes our metrics job. They previously failed to do insufficient disk space (the metrics repo was too large). This commit fixes the problem by just removing unneeded stuff from the runners. See [this](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/actions/runs/3383850875) semi-successful action run

title: Drop GAT workarounds
body:
**What it does:**
- Migrates GatWorkarounds to actual GATs

**Good to know:**
- Trait `ConnectionSealed` is kept to keep the feature gate around the Connection implementation.
- I had to keep the associated type on `RowFieldLifetimeHelper` in order to express `FieldRet` without the lifetime of `Row`
- This increases the minimal rust version from `1.60.0` to `1.65.0`

title: Fix #3380 by implementing all necessary traits
Fix: Broken link to r2d2 docs
body: I'm assuming the intention is to link to the current r2d2 crate docs from the ConnectionManager struct. Changed it to refer to https://docs.rs/r2d2/latest/r2d2/

title: Rewrite table! as proc_macro
body:
This commits rewrites `diesel::table!` as proc marco. The rewrite is done for the following reasons:

* Allow to reuse the syn parser of `table!` for other functionality as well (That's the main reason, might be really useful for some ideas regarding to for example generating migrations by diffing `schema.rs` + the actual database in `diesel-cli`)
* Simpler to read, as the old `macro_rules!` based implementation was quite hard to follow (That should make it easier to implement future changes to `table!` as well)
* Better error reporting, as we now can control the exact spans of items.

title: Revert "Fix #3330"
body:
Reverts diesel-rs/diesel#3349

See #3368 for the reasoning

Reopens #3330 

Additionally I suggest to release a 2.0.2 version containing this fix soon.

title: Use `insta` for testing `diesel print-schema`
body: This simplifies updating any of the existing test cases or adding a new one as `insta` automatically collects the new results and provides tools/environment variables to put everything into the right place.

title: Add some additional checks to `#[derive(Selectable)]` to ensure field
body:
compatibility

We generate an additional function with trait bounds for each fields to check whether a certain rust field type is compatible with the underlying database type. This greatly improves error messages for potential type mismatches, as the user now gets an error message that points to the field causing the problem + which has a pretty clear meaning (stating that `FromSql<…>` is not implemented).

Unfortunaly that's not a perfect solution as we need to check against **concrete** backend implementation. This PR solves this by hard-coding all three out of the box supported backends (behind the corresponding feature flags). That works for cases where users want to have compatibility with all enabled backends, but there are certainly use-cases where this is not the case. We might need some opt-in/opt-out system here to prevent this from being a breaking change or making it impossible to support valid use-cases. On the one hand we might want to have this as default as the improved error messages is something which is really helpful for new users, on the other hand I cannot see how that would be possible without breaking changes.

Another down-side of this approach is that it generates basically duplicated error messages when more than one backend is enabled.

This is currently marked as Draft as I see that more as request for comments due to the various problems outlined above. I really would like to see something like that in stable diesel as this would improve the usability quite significantly in my opinion. (We would just need to tell everyone to use `Selectable` and after that at least many cryptic errors will go away)

title: Backport fixes to 2.0.0
body:
This PR prepares a 2.0.1 release containing various fixes. I would like to issue an release next week.
It contains the following PRs:

https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3353
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3349
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3351
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3344
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3341
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3340
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3338
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3331
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3327
https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/pull/3302

title: Fix Unused Qualifications Issue in Insertable
body:
Suppresses the lint so that using -Dunused_qualifications does not throw an error for structs using the Insertable macro. 

Fixes https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues/3313

title: Reenable diesel_async in benchmarks by using the crates.io release
Fix #3330
body:
This commits fixes an issue with our dsl generating an invalid query for `UPSERT` statements with `WHERE` clauses. As described in https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-insert.html `WHERE` is only valid in combination with `DO UPDATE` here. In detail this commit fixes the following issues:

* `WHERE` appears now in the correct place in the generated query (after `ON UPDATE SET …` instead of before this clause
* We now reject queries that use `filter_target` but `DO NOTHING` as action. Those are not valid as outlined in the postgresql documentation.

In addition a test case for both issues is added.

Similarly to #3341 this contains a technically breaking change, as it turns more broken queries in compile-errors. Similar to that issue I would classify that as bug fix.

title: Clear db connection after database error
body: Closes #3342

title: Add "char" type for postgresql.
body: This is needed e.g. for setweight https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/functions-textsearch.html

title: Verify that group_by expression is valid for the given table
body:
This commit fixes a bug where diesel would accept group by expressions that contain columns of tables not even appearing in the current from clause. The provided compile test contains some examples that would have been accepted before this commit (not all of them where accepted before, only those with `.select(…).group_by(…)`).

This is technically a breaking change as this rejects previously accepted queries. However I would argue that this is at the same time a critical bugfix as this turns invalid queries in a compiler error.

I explicitly request a review from @diesel-rs/core here how to handle this fix. I propose that we call this a bug fix even if it's an breaking change (those are allowed in the semver spec). I would assume that this either does not break working code (as the generated queries where broken anyway) or at least point the code author at potential issues with their code.
